['A General Counsel provides legal advice in complex areas of the law to an organisation.', 'This role requires deep industry knowledge, in areas such as advanced risk and compliance, and project management functions.', 'Responsibilities include interpreting significant legal developments and presenting their impact on the organisation, safeguarding and advancing legal and business ethical behaviour, and supervising team members in the legal department.', 'The individual is also involved in developing and implementing project management processes and systems, and managing conflicts within the organisation.', 'Develop and implement a data protection framework, business policies and project management processes and systems.', "Facilitate the organisation's compliance with regulatory obligations and safeguard ethical behaviour within the organization.", 'Identify and develop business opportunities for legal development.', 'Identify key emerging trends affecting the legal services industry and the organisation.', 'Manage legal department team to deal with multiple work demands, facilitate teamwork and provide mentorship.', 'Negotiate and draft complex legal contracts in specialist areas of law, informed by deep industry expertise.', 'Synthesise legal knowledge with business objectives.', 'Undertake resource and budget planning for the legal department.']

['A Global Counsel provides expert legal and strategic business advice to an organisation as a trusted adviser to its Board of Directors.', 'The role also involves crisis management and the development and evaluation of solutions.', 'Strategic leadership, insights and decision-making are a must in making assessments and recommendations to the management.', "The individual should possess a profound understanding of the organisation's business and industry, and advanced problem-solving and critical thinking skills to evaluate, develop and implement solutions to issues and crises.", 'Advise on risk management and compliance issues', 'Develop the organisation and business for the future.', 'Function as ethical conscience of the business and manage complex ethical and compliance issues.', 'Manage crisis situations.', 'Manage resources and prepare budget for the legal department and business operations.', 'Manage the legal administration of the organisation.', 'Provide expert industry-specific legal and business advice', 'Provide leadership to other teams.', 'Select panel of external counsel.', 'Serve as a member of the Board of Directors in the organisation.', 'Serve on external committees and advisory panels.', 'Strategise using expert legal analysis and problem-solving in highly complex situations.', 'Undertake the company secretary function in the organisation.']

['A Legal Counsel is an in-house lawyer who advises an organisation on legal matters.', 'Responsibilities include analysing facts and applying legal knowledge and skills to provide sound legal solutions.', 'This entails internal compliance monitoring and risk evaluation of business decisions and operations.', "The individual also drafts papers and agreements, and protects the organisation's intellectual property.", 'This individual should have a deep understanding of the organisation and the wider industry, the financial literacy and commercial acumen to complement technical legal knowledge and skills, be able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team and maintain composure in the face of stressful situations.', 'Conduct negotiation and drafting across various areas of the law.', 'Develop and maintain standard operating procedures for legal department and other areas of responsibility.', 'Facilitate evidence-based decision-making through the use of data and analytics tools relevant to the legal and regulatory context of the organisation.', 'Shape and implement legal solutions for the organisation.', 'Undertake corporate secretarial matters.', 'Undertake project management processes relating to legal matters.']

['A Contracts Manager negotiates, drafts, reviews and maintains contractual documents for an organisation.', 'Responsibilities include developing, implementing and maintaining contract management systems and policies in legal service environments, such as corporations or government agencies.', 'The individual is expected to perform advisory and supervisory duties that entail monitoring, reporting, planning and coordination.', 'The job scope also includes proactively reviewing and improving compliance processes, systems and policies.', 'Specialist knowledge and skills may be required for niche areas, such as structured products and derivatives documentation in the Banking and Finance industry.', 'Facilitate development of technology which automates document production for standardised transaction.', 'Facilitate the development and implementation of contracts management policies and procedures in compliance with regulatory standards and industry best practices.', 'Maintain the currency of documentation templates and guidance notes on usage.', 'Negotiate, draft, review, amend and/or maintain a range of routinely-encountered but complex agreements and related documentation.', 'Research and communicate developments on regulatory issues having an impact on the agreements regularly entered into by the organisation.']

['An Intellectual Property (IP) Manager develops, implements and maintains IP management systems and policies in an organisational setting.', 'This individual needs to be familiar with established legal procedures, formats and systems for creating, procuring, maintaining, updating and protecting a range of IP owned or licensed by an organisation, and possess specialist knowledge and skills for certain industries involving complex patents, such as the engineering and biomedical industries.', 'The Manager has advisory and supervisory duties that require significant monitoring, reporting, planning and coordination, and should be proactive in reviewing IP management processes, systems and policies, in pursuit of continuous improvement.', 'Assist in preparation of documentation for intellectual property related adjudication, arbitration, mediation, negotiations.', 'Conduct investigations and legal research on intellectual property related issues.', 'Draft, review, formalize and file intellectual property application forms.', 'Perform due diligence to support intellectual property acquisition processes.']

["A Compliance / Data Protection Manager develops, implements and maintains an organisation's risk management and compliance processes and systems, in line with the legal requirements and customary practices of the industry.", 'The individual typically works in the legal or compliance department, and may be required to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team, which includes finance and government relations professionals.', 'The work scope encompasses advisory and supervisory duties that entail monitoring, reporting, planning and coordination.', 'The individual is expected to proactively review and improve compliance processes, systems and policies.', 'Technical knowledge is required if the individual is working in a highly specialised industry, such as in Financial Services or Information Technology Services.', 'Develop, document and administer data protection and confidential information management protocols as part of information security workflows.', 'Develop, document and administer standardised AML, KYC and conflicts-checks protocols as part of case management and client-intake workflows.', 'Develop, document and administer standardised grievance handling, whistle-blowing and workplace safety and health protocols as part of human resource management workflows.', 'Develop, document and administer standardised procurement, financial planning, review and audit protocols as part of financial management workflows.', 'Make recommendations to management on addressing deficiencies and risks surfaced through scheduled process and systems reviews, and implement approved recommendations.', 'Undertake regular reviews of compliance with internal protocols and external regulatory requirements, and report to management any deficiencies and risks.']

['A Clerk has administrative and clerical duties, handling work that is not substantively legal, yet involves details and contexts that require familiarity with key systems and nomenclature used by the legal community.', 'Responsibilities include a range of administrative tasks, such as receptionist duties, routine office maintenance and procurement, as well as typing and formatting business correspondences and legal documents, and proofreading print and digital materials.', 'The individual uses common legal portals for administrative tasks and operates office equipment such as personal computers, photocopiers, scanners and fax machines.', 'The individual must possess a strong professionalism and comply with legal industry protocols and norms, duties of confidentiality, data management best practices and professional ethical requirements.', 'Act with professionalism.', 'Comply with data management best practices.', 'Comply with legal industry protocols and norms, professional ethical requirement and duties of confidentiality.', 'Operate common workplace technologies and use common legal portals for administrative tasks.', 'Perform receptionist and routine office maintenance and procurement duties.', 'Perform word-processing duties and proofread printed and digital documents.', 'Take instructions and seek clarification to complete tasks.']

['A Knowledge Manager develops, implements and maintains knowledge and information management systems and processes.', 'Responsibilities include organising and managing the creation, acquisition and reuse of workplace knowledge and information.', 'The individual sets up and maintains libraries of references, precedents and templates, both online and offline, and advises senior management on legal knowledge and information management systems, staying up to date on the latest trends and developments.', 'The individual also facilitates training in the use of knowledge and information systems, and identifies and addresses gaps in information literacy.', 'Develop, implement and maintain knowledge and information management processes and systems in legal service environments.', 'Facilitate training in the correct usage of knowledge and information management systems.', 'Identify and address gaps in information literacy at the workplace.', 'Keep updated on and advise senior management on the developments in legal knowledge and information management systems.', 'Organise and maintain the creation, acquisition and reuse of workplace knowledge and information in the form of knowledge management and information management policies and processes.', 'Set up and maintain physical and online libraries of references, precedents and templates.']

["An Office Administrator manages a law firm's administrative operations, in areas such as finance, human resources and procurement, and reviews and maintains the standard operating procedures for such areas.", 'The individual is required to work with internal and external specialists across functions such as human resources, finance, IT and compliance.', 'This role demands effective management of competing demands on time and resources.', 'Assist with corporate secretarial requirements/duties.', 'Document and maintain standard operating procedures.', 'Manage human resource matters for department or firm.', 'Perform basic legal research.', 'Prepare budget for department or firm operations.', 'Prepare financial reports.']

['A Legal Project Manager develops, implements and maintains project management processes and systems, and undertakes business process re-engineering in legal services environments, as part of the legal operations team in a law firm or legal department.', 'This individual should have specialist project management knowledge and skills, to work closely with legal professionals with advisory or advocacy responsibilities and ensure that legal matters are resourced and progressed in a timely fashion, and costed accurately and sustainably.', 'The Manager has advisory and supervisory duties that require significant monitoring, reporting, planning and coordination, and should be proactive in reviewing project management processes, systems and policies, in pursuit of continuous improvement.', 'Analyse current legal operations within the firm or department and redesign key processes to improve their effectiveness having regard to changes in strategic plans, macroeconomic circumstances and disruptive technologies.', 'Apply project management concepts in legal service environments.', 'Develop, implement and maintain legal project management systems and processes to ensure consistently high quality client services and work products, delivered efficiently and cost-effectively.', 'Review and improve the management of legal cases and matters having regard to issues of scope, cost, time, quality, documentation, administration and risk management.']

['A Conservator preserves and restores cultural collections and artefacts.', 'An expert in understanding artefacts and how they deteriorate, the Conservator ensures the correct treatment and ideal conditions to keep artefacts in good condition and prolong their lifespan.', 'The Conservator may conduct condition checks in galleries, museums, and art storage facilities to monitor the environments in which these artefacts are kept.', 'The individual may also undertake research and network with other conservation organisations, to keep abreast with new technologies and methods of conservation.', 'Additional roles include providing consultation to other organisations or individuals on the maintenance, storage and display of their artworks and artefacts.', 'Apply necessary conservation treatment to artefacts', 'Assess and examinecondition ofartefactsto determine treatment method', 'Check artefacts to ensure they are safe and properly displayed', 'Check display environment for its temperature and humidity', 'Conduct restoration work according to standard procedureif an artefactisdamaged', 'Document and record condition of artefacts and the recommended treatment method', 'Give adviceon transport, handling and displaying of artefacts when necessary', 'Prepare report on artefacts and other research reports', 'Support with conservation study and relevant research projects']

['A Curator conceptualises and organises exhibitions in an art space.', 'Extensive research on the history, themes, ideologies and artists of the chosen concept is conducted by the Curator to select artworks to be exhibited and to prepare write-ups for the collection.', 'To ensure that the work is presented as the artist intends, the Curator works closely with the artists on how best to display the work.', 'In large institutions where they have their own art museums, the Curator helps to acquire the artworks and manage the collection.', 'On top of presenting exhibitions, the Curator also contributes to the academic community through talks and articles.', 'Conceptualise an exhibition or collection', 'Conceptualise display of secured artworks in the specified exhibition space', 'Contact selected artist(s) and institutions to check for availability of work/willingness of artist to collaborate', 'Coordinate installation/de-installation of the artworks, labels and exhibition description', 'Deliver curator?s talks and/or tours on the artists/exhibition/institution', 'Identify artists and/or artworks related to topic of exhibition', 'Loan artworks from artists, collectors, or collections', 'Prepare written material on the exhibited artworks for publication and/or various media which usually includes an essay for the catalogue or exhibition collateral, encompassing the concerns and rationale of the artist/exhibition', 'Research the themes or artist(s) with respect to the concept/direction chosen for the exhibition or collection', 'Select artworks and organise them for the exhibition', 'Source artworks']

['An Operating Engineer leads a team of operators and technicians to ensure smooth running of operations.', 'Responsibilities include recording anything unusual in operations, promptly fixing any disruptions to the operational processes, and preparing and updating all operations records.', 'The individual develops and maintains standard procedures and equipment checklists.', 'The job also entails tracking operational performance, monitoring chemical consumption and managing the inventory for operations.', 'The Operating Engineer also trains staff and takes charge of workplace safety.', 'Conduct training for operation staff', 'Develop standard operational procedures for operation and equipment maintenance process', 'Lead operation team such as operators and technicians in operation process', 'Maintain workplace safety', 'Prepare and report all operations activities and status', 'Rectify operation issues and record abnormalities occurred during operation', 'Track chemical consumption rate to accurately estimate restock order period and amount']

['As its name implies, a Power Plant Operator works at a facility that produces electricity.', 'Responsibilities include checking readings from gauges and documenting energy produced.', 'The individual also monitors equipment to ensure that it is running efficiently, and may make adjustments or repairs if necessary.', 'This individual works closely with Plant Engineers and Plant Managers.', 'Carry out inspections around the plant and record readings from instruments', 'Carry out operational tasks according to approved procedures', 'Check levels of fuel for the generators', 'Follow all environmental, health and safety policies, and objectives', 'Monitor process operations, and operate computerised plant control system', 'Report plant status and check equipment for problems that may happen', 'Work closely with Plant Engineers and Plant Managers']

['Part of the technical team, a Process Engineer (Energy and Chemicals) develops and optimises chemical manufacturing processes.', 'The individual?\x99s responsibilities include troubleshooting issues, and improving operations by testing new materials, processes and equipment.', 'The individual works closely with the operations team.', 'Reviewing the safety of processes in new projects is also part of the job.', 'Develop process procedure for production facilities', 'Investigate and troubleshoot plant or process issues', 'Monitor safe working conditions and maintain workplace safety', 'Review existing procedures and modify or introduce new work processes to improve efficiency', 'Test out new materials or equipment on their suitability for operations']

['In the manufacturing process of a chemical plant, a Process Technician supports and handles the daily operational tasks in the assigned unit.', 'Responsibilities include monitoring measuring instruments, and checking levels of solutions in storage vessels and the temperature of equipment.', 'The Process Technician also assists with maintenance of equipment and troubleshooting of problems.', 'The Technician ensures that the work area is clean, neat and safe.', 'Create the steps for chemical functions at the production plant', 'Oversee safety at work', 'Study and solve station problems or other work problems', 'Study current methods and make changes to work steps to increase output', 'Test out new stock or equipment on its suitability for daily functions']

['A Quality Control Engineer oversees the standards and procedures of the production plant.', 'The individual leads and directs a team of technicians who test products and document the results.', 'Other responsibilities include performing audits on quality and training on quality standards and practices.', 'They also include inspecting and evaluating materials from new suppliers.', 'When a production issue arises, the Quality Control Engineer conducts an analysis to identify the source of the problem and works with relevant parties to rectify the problem promptly.', 'Analyse quality data and summarise findings', 'Conduct root cause analysis during an occurrence of issue to identify causes', 'Conduct training on quality control standards and practices', 'Develop and implement production qualitystandards and procedures', 'Direct technicians in measuring, product testing and recording of findings', 'Evaluate and qualify new suppliers and their materials', 'Handle projects related to quality control and safety', 'Prepare reports on quality data and analysis for management review', 'Review technicians? records and reports, and ensure accurate input of data', 'Work closely with respective departments to ensure operational procedures are in accordance to requirements']

["The Head, Learning and Organisation Development, is responsible for establishing an organisation's learning and development strategy.", "The individual is also required to recommend organisational design and spearhead organisational change interventions to realise the organisation's vision, mission and business strategy effectively.", 'This leader allocates budgets for learning and development programmes to build capabilities in the organisation, and influences stakeholders to redesign the organisational model.', "The role also encompasses setting direction and articulating the goals and ["A 2nd, 3rd or 4th Mate is responsible for planning a ship's route and navigating the ship.", 'Responsibilities include determining the geographical position of the ship, and keeping watch on the bridge and over its equipment.

['A Marine Surveyor (Class) has two roles - one, as a representative of the Classification Society; and the other as an inspector on behalf of the country with which the vessel is registered (the Flag State).', "For the first role, the individual ensures that the construction of the ship and all its on-board components and machinery comply with the Classification Society's rules for construction and outfitting, and thereafter the ship is maintained fit to proceed trading.", 'Once the inspection or survey is satisfactorily completed, the Surveyor makes recommendations to the Classification Society or the Flag State, while assessing the risks of recommendations made.', 'The recommendations made could be that the vessel be given a clean bill of health, or that various defects must be corrected within a given time.', 'The Surveyor may also identify bottlenecks and propose improvements to enhance workflow and ensure optimisation of resources.', 'When acting on behalf of the Flag State, the Marine Surveyor follows a clear set of guidelines issued by the registering country.', "The Marine Surveyor is expected to execute duties with fidelity, ensuring strict and impartial justice to all parties whose property is under the individual's supervision.", 'This job suits a physically fit person who can work in confined spaces and from heights, climb the steep ladders and ['A Port Limit Helmsman manoeuvres and handles a craft operating within the port while ensuring the safety of the boat, as well as its passengers, crew and other users.', 'This includes mooring the boat for passengers to board or disembark.', 'The Port Limit Helmsman supports other maritime activities by ferrying ship agents and seafarers between vessels and shore, ferrying harbour pilots to commercial ships, and transporting supplies and equipment to ships in anchorage.', 'This job entails understanding tides, waters, coastlines, marine hazards and the weather as well as the craft and its equipment.', 'The Port Limit Helmsman must also understand sound signals and perform basic chartwork.', "Familiarity with Singapore's territorial waters is necessary, as is the ability to use navigational equipment and aids to verify the accuracy of a vessel's course.", 'The Port Limit Helmsman is required to follow Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) regulations, procedures and circulars, as well as the International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea, and rules related to sailing and steering, and lights and shapes carried by various craft.', 'Monitoring and anticipating potential problems during operations and alerting the relevant authorities to them, the Port Limit Helmsman must be able to think ahead, follow through on instructions and communicate effectively through various channels, including email, radio and phone.', 'Apply first aid to survivors', 'Carry out a rescue in a smoke-filled space', 'Check condition and seaworthiness of the boat or craft', 'Conduct refuelling operations', 'Manage survivors and survival craft after abandoning ship', 'Take appropriate action in compliance with established procedures upon identifying muster signals', 'Take charge of a survival craft or rescue boat during and after launch', 'Use locating devices, including communication and signalling apparatus']

["A Post Fixture Executive monitors a vessel's schedule and status before it arrives in port.", 'This enables the Executive to serve the appropriate delivery and re-delivery notices for the vessel, and arrange for timely hire payments from charterers.', 'These include calculating various fees and deductions.', 'The Post Fixture Executive also handles laytime calculations, i.e.', 'fees payable to the port based on time allocated for a vessel to load or unload its cargo.', 'The Executive also assists in the negotiation of any laytime disputes.', "If the length of the agreed charter period is affected, the Executive processes compensation to the shipowner for delays or claims for refunds for time saved.

The Executive also checks port disbursements, the expenses paid by the ship's agent on behalf of the shipowner.", 'The Executive also oversees the processing of commissions to brokers.

The Executive is also required to identify bottlenecks and propose improvements to workflow, as well as assist with their implementation.

['A Chief Financial Officer heads the finance function of an organisation.', 'The Chief Financial Officer, commonly referred to as the CFO, acts as a strategic business advisor in matters relating to finance and accounting ??and plays a significant role in growing the company by aligning finance and business strategies.

Acting as a navigator and integrator of the organisation, the CFO balances the responsibilities of stewardship of its finance and accounting functions with business partnership.', "As the custodian of the organisation's critical assets and financial health, the CFO reports and provides advice to the board, Chief Executive Officer and senior management team on the company's performance, financial and risk issues, organisational liabilities and other developments.", 'Duties include obtaining board approvals, getting involved in public or shareholder announcements, and communicating with the investor community.

The CFO also ensures compliance with financial regulations, signs off on financial statements, and secures an efficient and effective structure to provide a range of business support services including cashflow management, financial planning and analysis, treasury functions, finance operations and tax.', 'The CFO supports growth through participating in capital market financing initiatives, and Mergers and Acquisition activities which involve negotiations, pricing, due diligence and valuation.', 'Responsible for driving change in the finance function and organisation-wide, the CFO is expected to push for business improvement initiatives, such as developing processes and promoting innovations.

Beyond the finance role, the CFO may be tasked to oversee functions such as human resource, legal, compliance, corporate governance and corporate social responsibility.', "Act as a strategic business advisor guiding a company's long-term financial strategy", "Communicate organisation's financial and business information to investor community", 'Connect underlying complex non-financial drivers of a business to financial information through analytics', 'Drive down effective tax rates', 'Drive forecasting and budgeting to align the finance function with the strategic vision of the business', 'Ensure organisation complies with regulations involving the filing of their financial and tax statements', 'Ensure that budgets are able to support and are sustainable to match strategic goals', 'Evaluate Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) opportunities to create shareholder value', 'Find new ways to sustain performance and grow the business', 'Lead effective communication to engage stakeholders for matters arising from risk, controls and compliance', 'Lead efforts in the radical redesign of core business processes to achieve significant improvement in productivity and efficiency', 'Lead finance teams on the technical and quality aspects of financial reporting', 'Lead organisation to develop strategic priorities, culture and governance', 'Manage risks by taking an integrated view of all the various uncertainties that exist across an organisation', 'Manage the risks of the whole M&A process', 'Manage working relationship with various stakeholders', "Oversee the organisation's financial reporting function", 'Provide executive support to the Board of Directors with financial and non-financial information', 'Use analytics to support business growth and needs, as well as identify potential problems in advance as part of risk management', 'Use predictive analytics as an enabler to forecast future performance and perform stress testing on business lines']

['A Conductor directs, conducts and leads the instrumental or vocal performances of musical ensembles such as orchestras, bands or choirs.', 'The Conductor selects and arranges music and composition, and plans the rehearsals and performances.', 'The entire musical ensemble is led by the Conductor who plays a critical role in ensuring that the balancing, timing, rhythm, melody and volume are aligned.', 'The Conductor also looks into the administrative details that come with leading the musical ensemble.', 'Audition and select new members of the musical ensemble', 'Carry out administrative and management duties to ensure that the ensemble has a working and sustainable budget', 'Create or transcribe musical compositions, arrangements or scores', 'Develop own interpretations of the music and convey to the ensemble to keep unity and harmony', 'Direct the musical ensemble at rehearsals and live or recorded performances', 'Give feedback to musicians and section leaders so that they can achieve the sound and style intended for the music piece', 'Plan and schedule rehearsals and performances', 'Position members within the musical ensemble to obtain tonal and harmonic balance among the various sections', 'Represent the musical ensemble in the promotion and publicity of the performances', 'Select the music to perform depending on availability of musical scores and the need for repertoire and musical variety', 'Set the tempo, tone, pitch, volume of a musical performance using a baton or visible body and arm gestures', 'Study and learn the musical scores to give correct signals to ensure accurate timing when musicians in orchestra perform']

['A Sound Designer is responsible for the audio elements in a variety of disciplines, including filmmaking, television production, theatre and video game development.', 'This role - which includes recording, mixing and editing of speeches, music and sound effects - requires frequent collaboration with producers, performers and other production staff to achieve the desired outcomes.', 'Through manipulating the composed or recorded audio, the Sound Designer seeks to achieve the appropriate atmosphere and sound at a desired level of audio quality.', 'Convert video and audio recordings into digital formats for editing or archiving', 'Create, design and edit music and sound effects', 'Determine the desired sound effects for a production', 'Manage use and maintenance of recording equipment for recording sessions and live performance', 'Mix and edit voices, music, and taped sound effects for live performances and for pre-recorded events', 'Record speech, music, and other sounds on recording media', 'Regulate volume level and sound quality during recording sessions', 'Reproduce and duplicate sound recordings from original recording media', 'Separate instruments, vocals, and other sounds, and combine sounds later during the mixing or post production stage', 'Synchronise and equalise pre-recorded dialogue, music, and sound effects']

['A Sound Engineer or Technician supports the sound production team in the technical aspects of audio productions for live broadcasts, stage performances and movie productions ??to achieve optimum sound quality.', 'The Sound Engineer operates audio equipment and systems including audio mixing consoles, microphones and sound reinforcement devices as well as audio recording and editing hardware and software.', 'The Sound Engineer typically works very closely with the Sound Designer, Art Director or Production Manager.', 'Collaborate with director and producer to determine technical details of production', 'Create musical instrument digital interface programmes for music projects, commercials or film post-production', 'Keep logs of recordings', 'Manage the maintenance and serviceability of sound equipment', 'Mix and edit voices, music and sound effects for live performances, pre-recorded events and post recording, using sound mixing boards', 'Operate control consoles for sound mixing inputs', 'Pack and store equipment appropriately after event completion', 'Reproduce and duplicate sound recordings using sound editing and duplication equipment', 'Separate instruments, vocals, and other sounds, and combine sounds later during the mixing or post production stage', 'Set up and operate audio equipment for sound production', 'Set up, test, and adjust recording equipment for recording sessions and live performances', 'Synchronise and equalise pre-recorded dialogue, music, and sound effects']

['A Stage Manager works behind the scenes and manages all production activities.', 'A big part of this role is to coordinate the work of actors, designers, stage crew and technicians throughout the production process.', 'This role involves managing the rehearsal schedules and coordinating the entire process; as well as working with the designers and craftspeople to support their logistical needs.', 'It also includes calling cues to actors to go on stage to ensure the smooth running of the rehearsals and productions.', 'Co-ordinate and facilitate the rehearsal process of a production', "Communicate the director's instructions and requests to designers and crafts people", 'Develop and maintain detailed timings of cues for the smooth running of the show and disseminate the information to production departments', 'Draw up plan for the stage crew to follow throughout the performance', 'Manage and co-ordinate the work of stage crew', 'Manage the calling of cues for a show', 'Manage the rehearsals, schedules and performances', 'Prepare reports of rehearsals']

['A Staging Engineer is responsible for all technical aspects relating to the physical stage structure of a production.', 'This includes ensuring that the stage carpentry is able to support the weight of the performers, stage props, equipment, curtains and backdrops.', 'The Stage Engineer also looks into stage rigging, a behind-the-scenes system that enables the stagehands to remain obscure from the audience?\x99s view while carrying out their duties.', 'Stage Engineers are also required to support other aspects of stage activities such as managing the inventory and the serviceability of stage props, furniture and set dressing.', 'During production or rehearsals, the Stage Engineer is the one who gives a cue to the stage technicians when it is time to make set changes between scenes.', 'Assist in product requisition by providing product information, justification for purchase and seeking of quotations from vendors', 'Conduct regular in-house maintenance to ensure equipment and systems are in operational condition', 'Manage inventory of stage equipment', 'Supervise external maintenance and installation of equipment, system and any other matters related to the venues', 'Support the technical requirements for the production', 'Work closely with Stage Manager to plan work schedules for the team and event requirements']

['A Teaching Artist coaches individuals on the arts through theory and practical lessons.', 'Besides designing, developing and delivering education programmes, the Teaching Artist also organises promotional activities to drive awareness for the arts.', 'The Teaching Artist may work in an educational institution, or choose to teach as a freelancer or on a contract basis.', 'Apply the principles of intellectual property to protect and optimise created work', 'Coach learners in the mastery and creation of artistic work', 'Conduct assessment of students according to arts and entertainment qualification standards', 'Deliver arts education programmes', 'Design and develop arts education programmes', 'Identify and expose learners to external arts and entertainment work for enrichment', 'Monitor progress of the learners', 'Plan promotional activities of created work', 'Research and analyse history and theory to inform artistic practice', 'Review and enhance the curriculum']

['A Technical Manager works with the stage management team to manage and coordinate all technical aspects of a stage production.', 'Besides overseeing the setup and execution of the technical requirements, the Manager also maintains the inventory of equipment, plans equipment purchases and looks after all repairs or replacements of equipment.', 'Other responsibilities include managing the crew work schedules and facility maintenance activities.', 'Determine technical requirements for performance including facility use and rental', 'Direct technical aspects during productions, including checking and switching between video sources', 'Manage crew and facility requirements', 'Set up and execute video transitions and special effects', 'Test the equipment to ensure the equipment is in proper working condition', 'Understand the correct use of equipment, including setup and repair', 'Work closely with Set Designer and oversee the technical aspects of the set design and construction']

['A Video Recording Engineer oversees all aspects of video recording operations for film and television broadcasts, from recording to editing and transmission of video images.', 'This role requires working with the video recording technicians to ensure high image quality during shooting; the Production Director and Artistic Director to fine-tune the frames and composition of each shot; and the Director of Photography to choreograph camera moves for the production.', 'The Video Recording Engineer takes on different levels of responsibility depending on the type of production.', 'Collaborate with Production Director, Artistic Director, Audio Engineer and Stage Manager for video production', 'Edit video records after production to improve sequencing flow and image quality', 'Guide video recording technicians during video shooting for the production', 'Instruct video recording technicians in preparation of pre-production materials and equipment', 'Instruct video recording technicians on the setting up of recording equipment', 'Manage usage of video recording equipment in production', 'Plan and co-ordinate video recording requirements with Production Director and Artistic Director', 'Recommend adoption of software and technology to optimise video recording quality', 'Work closely with Director of Photography to capture the best composition, framing, tracking, and image quality']

['A Wardrobe Master supervises all wardrobe-related activities to meet the costume requirements of a production.', 'The Wardrobe Master guides the team of costume, make-up and hairstyling professionals on the production, and sources costumes and accessories for the performers.', 'Other duties include overseeing the maintenance, sale and eventual disposal of these items as well as maintaining the equipment in the wardrobe unit.', 'The role also entails managing budgets and allocating dressers to performers.', 'Coordinate the assignment of outfits to specific performers', 'Coordinate the return of hired outfits and the sale or disposal of any remaining costumes and personal props', "Liaise with costume designer and director to identify costume, makeup, and hair requirements to meet production's design", 'Liaise with the costume designer, tailors and costume vendors to acquire resources to meet costume design requirements of a production', 'Maintain inventories of costumes, personal props, wigs and make-up items', "Manage budget for the costume, makeup, and hair requirements to meet production's requirements", 'Manage the fabrication and application of costumes, wigs, and make-up for performers', 'Oversee the maintenance of costumes, personal props, wigs and make-up items, including inspections and repairs or restoration of the items', 'Oversee the maintenance of equipment required for costumes, jewellery, gloves and wigs', 'Work with the stage manager and director to maintain costume continuity']

['The Assistant Vice President, Asset Liability Management, is a specialist in advisory and regulatory risk management who leads the compliance department in financial services compliance, monitors staff performance, and trains subordinates.', 'Communicate methodologies and approaches to senior management and influence the Asset Liability Management (ALM) framework to enhance understanding of risks and the methodologies and their underlying assumptions', 'Identify and effect change when required and advocate the need for integrated risk management', 'Provide leadership for theAssetLiability Management (ALM) function, and ensure coherence and integrity of established frameworks, methodologies and processes, in alignment with other risk functions within the organisation', 'Provide leadership on data and technology infrastructure requirements to support forward-looking ALM framework, methodologies and processes', 'Understand capital structures and financing decisions']

['The Associate Vice President, Product Development, develops well planned and organised financial solutions that address client?\x99s investment, risk management and financing needs.', 'The individual has a deep understanding of different product types and asset classes such as stocks, bonds and cash; and a sound knowledge of how these products can be applied in a business context.', "Analyse clients' business strategy and operations, and their treasury and risk management activities to develop an understanding of their risk management or financing needs", 'Analyse key industry challenges facing global financial markets and potential scenarios shaping the future landscape of the financial markets industry', 'Assess operational risks assumed by or arising from financial market activities, and determine if mitigating actions need to be taken to limit financial and reputational losses', 'Demonstrate knowledge of the various types of valuation models, market indices and benchmarks used to price different types of financial market products', 'Draft product policies for the bespoke solutions, and seek internal approvals for new product pricing policy, risks, regulatory compliance, product/client suitability, and operational feasibility', 'Structure bespoke solutions using a range of financial market products and apply quantitative techniques to price and analyse the performance of those custom-made solutions under various business and financial market scenarios']

['The Associate Vice President, Treasury, manages the treasury operations and liquidity of a company, and helps to mitigate its operational, financial and reputational risk.', 'To do the job well, the individual takes into consideration the client?\x99s financial exposure, investment and funding needs across the spectrum of financial market products, including equities, fixed income, currencies and commodities.', 'The Associate Vice President gets new clients on board, sets up client investment accounts and determines their financial limits for the account, emplaces master agreements, generates and develops sales ideas and pitches, and collaborates with the company?\x99s Origination, Structuring, Trading, Research and Product teams.', 'Analyse key industry challenges facing global financial markets and potential scenarios shaping the future landscape of the financial markets industry', 'Assess operational risks assumed by or arising from financial market activities, and determine if mitigating actions need to be taken to limit financial and reputational losses', 'Demonstrate knowledge of the various types of valuation models, market indices and benchmarks used to price different types of financial markets products', 'Identify target clients and determine their suitability, financing needs, risk management requirements and investment objectives, and propose relevant sales opportunities', 'On-board new clients and manage relationships with clients, proactively discuss market information and sales opportunities in the financial markets while maintaining client confidentiality and mitigating potential reputational harm to the bank or financial institution, and continuously deliver value-added services to retain the clients', 'Track client metrics to establish client profitability and develop clients account strategy']

['The Business Manager understands and tries to meet customer financial investment needs and offers solutions through the right channels of products and services.', 'The Manager implements distribution strategies and initiatives to generate market-leading customer experiences that retain and grow the organisation?\x99s customer base.', 'The individual develops rapport with clients, sets sales targets, and provides support that sustains and improves client relations.', 'The Manager also oversees the sales activities of other business development staff.', 'Collaborate with internal stakeholders to achieve business revenue targets', 'Conduct research to identify, qualify and propose new customer segments', 'Develop business objectives andstrategies to acquire customers', 'Keep up to date with latest industry knowledge and developments', 'Manage, lead, support and coordinatethe growth of brand and new markets', 'Provide customers with regular market updates and recommend suitable products', 'Provide dedicated service to strengthen and deepen customer relationships', 'Resolve customer queries, complaints and feedback, ensuring high level of customer service recovery']

['The Compliance Director leads, manages and trains the team in an organisation?\x99s financial services compliance department.', 'This is the department that ensures teams follow all financial rules and regulations.', 'The individual specialises in advising teams on risk management and ensuring they adhere to regulations concerning risk management.', 'Advise board, senior management and other stakeholders  on compliance matters relating to financial services law and regulations as well as compliance-related industry practices', 'Design and deliver compliance training on regulatory compliance matters to inculcate compliance mindsets and behaviours in senior management', 'Establish an annual compliance plan, a compliance monitoring programme and an investigation framework to ensure compliance risks are regularly monitored and investigated, and appropriate corrective actions are taken in a timely manner', 'Establish an effective compliance risk management framework to evaluate and monitor compliance risks, and establish compliance policies and control procedures to mitigate such risks', 'Evaluate the impact of changes to the compliance function by applying knowledge of the financial services industry, and its trends and developments']

['A financial institution is required by regulation and corporate governance to comply with certain applicable laws, rules and regulations.', 'Enforcing those rules and regulations in financial practices helps to ensure integrity and sound reputation for the industry.', 'The Compliance Executive plays a supportive role in regulatory risk management, compliance advisory, execution and training.', 'This Executive assists in ensuring the financial institution complies with applicable laws, regulations and rules, as this is essential to preserving the integrity and reputation of the financial institution.', 'The individual analyses compliance matters, conducts audits, identifies compliance vulnerabilities and recommends control measures.', 'The Executive also assists senior compliance officers in organising, designing and delivering compliance training.', 'Execute the annual compliance plan and compliance monitoring programme under the direction and supervision of a senior compliance officer or team leader', 'Provide support to senior compliance officers in organising, designing and delivery of compliance training', 'Recognise common compliance vulnerabilities and recommend basic compliance controls to mitigate compliance risks', 'Research, gather data and complete an analysis of compliance matters under supervision of senior compliance officers']
